option.name: fileSummaryMaps
option.value: {"C:/Users/adris/AndroidStudioProjects/MyCalc":"{\"/app/src/test/java/com/example/mycalc/ExampleUnitTest.kt\":\"This file contains a single unit test class for a calculator application.\\n\\n`ExampleUnitTest`: A class that contains a single unit test to verify that the addition operation in the calculator application is working correctly.\\n\\n`addition_isCorrect()`: A test function that checks if the addition operation in the calculator application returns the expected result of 4 when adding 2 and 2.\",\"/app/src/androidTest/java/com/example/mycalc/ExampleInstrumentedTest.kt\":\"This file contains a single class and one function:\\n\\n`ExampleInstrumentedTest`: This class is an instrumented test class that runs on an Android device and tests the context of the app under test.\\n\\n`useAppContext()`: This function checks that the package name of the app under test is \\\"com.example.mycalc\\\", which is the expected package name for the app.\\n\\nOverall, this file is an Android instrumented test that verifies the context of the app under test, ensuring that the app is running in the expected environment.\",\"/build.gradle.kts\":\"This file is a top-level build file that sets up common configuration options for all sub-projects or modules in the Android application. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather sets up the necessary plugins for the Android application and Kotlin Android development.\\n\\nThe file does the following:\\n\\n1. Applies the Android application plugin to all sub-projects/modules.\\n2. Applies the Jetbrains Kotlin Android plugin to all sub-projects/modules.\",\"/app/build.gradle.kts\":\"This file is a Gradle build script for an Android application. It sets up the project configuration, including the Android application plugin, Kotlin support, and various dependencies. The file does not contain any classes or functions, but rather configures the build settings for the Android application.\\n\\nThe main sections of the file are:\\n\\n`plugins`: Specifies the Android application and Kotlin Android plugins to be used.\\n`android`: Configures the Android application settings, such as the namespace, compile SDK version, default config, and build types.\\n`compileOptions`: Sets the Java source and target compatibility to version 1.8.\\n`kotlinOptions`: Sets the JVM target to version 1.8.\\n`dependencies`: Specifies the dependencies for the Android application, including core Android libraries, material design, and testing frameworks.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/mycalc/MainActivity.kt\":\"This file contains a single class, `MainActivity`, which is the main activity of an Android app called \\\"MyCal\\\". The file also contains several functions that handle the functionality of the calculator app.\\n\\n`MainActivity`: The main activity of the Android app that implements a calculator functionality.\\n\\n`onCreate()`: Initializes the activity, sets up the UI, and attaches click listeners to the calculator buttons.\\n\\n`appendNumber()`: Appends a number to the result text view, handling the case of a new operation.\\n\\n`setOperation()`: Sets the current operation to be performed on the numbers.\",\"/settings.gradle.kts\":\"This file is a Gradle build configuration file for an Android project named \\\"MyCalc\\\". It sets up the plugin management, dependency resolution, and project structure for the application. There are no explicit classes or functions defined in this file. Instead, it configures the Gradle build system to manage the project\\u0027s dependencies and plugins.\\n\\nThe key elements in this file are:\\n\\n`pluginManagement`: Configures the repositories where Gradle plugins can be found, including Google, Maven Central, and the Gradle Plugin Portal.\\n`plugins`: Applies the \\\"org.gradle.toolchains.foojay-resolver-convention\\\" plugin, which helps manage the Java toolchain used for the project.\\n`dependencyResolutionManagement`: Configures the repositories where project dependencies can be found, including Google and Maven Central. It also sets the repositories mode to \\\"FAIL_ON_PROJECT_REPOS\\\", which means the build will fail if any project-specific repositories are used.\\n`rootProject.name`: Sets the name of the root project to \\\"MyCalc\\\".\\n`include(\\\":app\\\")`: Includes the \\\":app\\\" module as part of the project.\"}"}
